segments.text: I'm getting a little angry watching this whole situation unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so oblivious, it's almost unbelievable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can you not feel water sloshing around your feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those children are just so brazen with their cookie theft.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're going to get caught, or worse, they're going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's balance on that stool is truly terrible.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm sure any moment now, the stool will give way beneath him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I anticipate a loud crash, and then the woman will finally react.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's going to be a huge surprise for her when she turns around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she'll be more upset about the cookies or the flood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone really needs to intervene before things get completely out of hand.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This level of unawareness is frankly quite irritating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm just waiting for the inevitable chaos to break loose.
segments.speaker: PAR
